title: Firefox retains html bookmark information
content:
I'm in the process of exporting my FireFox bookmarks as html files.

In this process I noticed that everytime I save (export bookmarks as html) as a file a location on my disk, then open up that file to inspect/check - I notice that FireFox appends to the exported file rather than replace. Even though it asks if I want to replace the existing file during the save dialogue.

I'm using win 8.1

So, that's fine I though, 'let's' just delete that file and start over. Long story short, it does not work; I did the following.

Before closing FireFox I went into FireFox settings and click on all catagories of History - and cleared. I then closed FireFox then in Windows Explorer went to where the original file (exported html bookmarks), and deleted that file directly from windows.

I then opened up FireFox again and exported the my bookmarks as html to the same location again. Even though that destination no longer has a file from before - when I reopen the just now newly export html bookmark file - I see the contents are the same as before - (I has the appended/duplicated html bookmarks).

It's like instead of exporting the bookmarks I actually see in FireFox, it is referring to some saved information somewhere instead and saving that.

How can I export what bookmarks and folders I actually see in FireFox instead of some internal bookmarks/folders FireFox thinks I have - In other words - is there some file I can delete or setting to clear?

Thanks.

title: forced update has deleted all of my history, passwords, and bookmarks
content:
It's slowly dawning on me that this might be an unfixable problem, but I'll ask anyway.

When I updated my Macbook this morning, Firefox updated as well, and when I opened it, all my bookmarks, history, passwords, and extensions were missing. My Mozilla account was signed out, so I signed in, but since my password was only saved on Firefox, I had to reset it... I think this may have deleted my data permanently.

Weirdly, a similar thing happened to me with a recent previous update where all my bookmarks vanished. I tried to follow the guide to restore bookmarks, which didn't work, but when I quit and restarted Firefox they came back anyway so I didn't think too much about it.

It's definitely my fault for panicking and resetting my account password without reading the consequences too carefully, but I don't understand why these updates sign you out of the browser in the first place. I'm not the most tech savvy person in the world and it wasn't like they were warning before the update to make sure all my data was backed up... they just sprung it on me at 7 on a Saturday morning. Sorry for complaining. If anybody has any idea how to fix this, I'll be eternally grateful.

title: Restart PC delete cookies files and complet restart Mozilla
content: Hi, My operating system is Windows 11 and I have Mozilla version 138.0.1 (64-bit version) installed. I have a Mozilla account with you. I have the settings / privacy and security set so that Mozilla does not delete my cookies when I close the browser and also so that it does not delete my browsing history and site settings. The whole problem is that when I turn off my computer or simply restart it, after turning it on again, the Mozilla browser acts as if I installed it for the first time. I lose all cookies and browsing history and it logs me out of my Mozilla account, logs me out of my Google account, etc. I have been struggling with this for two days how to set it up, but I cannot get it to a state where I do not have to log in to my Mozilla account when I turn on the computer again and the cookies and browsing history are not deleted. I do not know if the Windows 11 system or the Mozilla browser deletes cookies when restarting my PC. Please let me know how to fix this problem. I also solved this problem with my IT programmer, but he couldn't set it up correctly either and together we came to the conclusion that it must be some kind of bug in the Windows update or in the Mozilla update. I would be very happy if you could help me. I have an old computer at work that still has Windows 7 and I also have Mozilla installed and everything works fine there. I turn on the PC and then Mozilla and all my accounts stay logged in and my entire browsing history is saved and I can continue working.

title: Firefox vägrar svälja att svenska språket tillagt som tillägg
content:
Jag har en iMac och jag har en Airbook. Båda har Firefox, på samma konto dvs sitter samman. Ändå skiljer vissa saker. Detta är en fråga om språket. Ett litet problem är att på airbook'en förstår inte firefox att jag vill skriva på svenska. Tex i denna ruta där frågan ställs markerar den vartenda ord och tycker det är dålig engelska dvs stryker under med rött.

Jag har jämfört inställningarna de bägge datorerna emellan. Har Firefox addon (tillägg) för Svenska. En märklig sak är att det verkar omöjligt att ta bort engelska språkpaketet om det finns där (den dator där det funkar saknar engelska tillägget som extra alternativ). Om jag klickar på något av de markerade orden här och kollar "språk" så anges att det är engelska - varför har inte svenska språkpaketet gått in, fast det står som installerat om man ser via tilläggens inställningar (där endast valet "ta bort", dvs är tillagt).

Detta dyker endast upp via Firefox, ej Chrome, alltså inte djupare i datorns inställningar om dess språk utan förefaller vara direkt en bugg eller felinställning i just Firefox. Men VAR? Varför får datorn för sig att jag försöker skriva på engelska, när svenska är installerat och inställt för.

title: reloading web page during debugging the page
content:
I'm debugging some web sites, and I often need to reload a page to see if a change I made on the server works correctly. On iPads and Android devices, this doesn't seem possible. Yes, there are the circular-arrow buttons, but they only work with Firefox (and Chrome;-) on my MacOS or my linux server, but not on my iPads or Android gadgets. They act like they're doing something, but the page on their screen doesn't change. (With FF or Chrome on the "real" computers, it does change). The only advice I find online is to use CTL-R or something similar but those "devices" don't have CTL buttons. Nothing else I guess at works, either.

When I ask online, I get replies that work for linux, MacOS or Windows, but clearly saying "iPad or Android doesn't help; the answers don't apply to those systems.

Am I missing something? Web developers need ways debug their code or html or whatever they're working on, and this requires checking how it works on the actual users' screens.
creator: jc1742

It's May 8, and I'm using v138, but dragging a tab onto another tab just reorders the tabs.
